summary: This is a sealed court order from Magistrate Judge Sarah Netburn, granting the U.S. Attorney's Office's application to compel the law firm Boies Schiller & Flexner LLP to provide confidential discovery materials from the civil case Jane Doe 43 v. Jeffrey Epstein, et al. to the government for use in a federal grand jury investigation, overriding a protective order from November 2018.

persons.name: Sarah Netburn
persons.context: Issued the sealed court order granting the government's application to obtain confidential discovery materials from a civil case for a grand jury investigation.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Named defendant in the referenced civil case Jane Doe 43 v. Jeffrey Epstein, et al., which is the source of the discovery materials sought by the grand jury.

connections.description: Judge Netburn issued an order that facilitates the release of discovery materials from a civil case involving Epstein to a federal grand jury investigation.

events.title: Protective Order Issued
events.description: A protective order was issued in the civil case Jane Doe 43 v. Jeffrey Epstein, et al., marking certain discovery materials as 'CONFIDENTIAL'.

events.title: Court Order to Unseal for Grand Jury
events.description: Magistrate Judge Sarah Netburn issued a sealed order permitting the law firm Boies Schiller & Flexner LLP to provide confidential discovery materials from the Epstein civil case to the government for a federal grand jury investigation.

keyFacts: The U.S. Attorney's Office successfully petitioned the court to bypass a protective order from a civil lawsuit (Jane Doe 43 v. Jeffrey Epstein) to obtain discovery materials for a federal grand jury investigation.
The order reveals active federal grand jury proceedings related to Jeffrey Epstein were ongoing as of February 2019.
The law firm Boies Schiller & Flexner LLP, which possessed the confidential discovery materials, was compelled by court order to provide them to the government.
The document is a sealed order, indicating the sensitive nature of the grand jury investigation and the materials being sought.
